column4: Ah.. damn.. no 64bits packages .. hmm .. is it possible to use 32bit packages with ubuntu 64bits?
yes
How do I get apt to find them? :)
deb http://blognux.free.fr/debian unstable main   << reports 404 NOT FOUND, which I guess is because it tries to find 64 bits packages.
edit your sources.conf file
at the moment ti just points apt to the 64 bit packages
Hmm .. sources.conf .. hmm
do you mean apt.conf ?
.. /etc/apt/sources.conf
I don't hae that file, nor a manpage for that file .
But I do have a manpage for apt.conf, which talks about Architecture ..
sorry /etc/apt/sources.list
its a simple text file
Uhm, I know. ;)  I'm trying to find out how to configure the $(ARCH) thing now. :)
only thing you really need is the 32 bit version of firefox
ahh, there.:D
No, I really need to get the webcam-detection-thingie to work, and they haven't compiled it for 64bits, it's on some non-official site.
I just download the tar.ball from the mozilla home page and unpacked it in /usr/lib and created a link to /usr/local/bin  to the firefox binary
I'm not interested in firefox. :)
just compile the app then
download the source and compile it, no biggie
What I probably should do is just fetch the kernel sources and patch'em with the proper usb drivers for the webcam.
Problem with compiling for ubuntu for me is that the gcc 4 vs gcc 3 thing is confusing the hell out of me. ;)
Last time I _used_ to compile things, I was using gcc 2.95 on Solaris .. time has been moving a tad too fast for me ;)
